item.description:
Caravaggio (Free Screening)

FREE

Wadsworth Atheneum's

Aetna Theater

7-9pm

Ronald Gregg, Senior Lecturer and Programming Director of Film Studies, Yale University, introduces the fictionalized retelling — in a series of vignettes — of the life of Michelangelo Merisi da Caravaggio.

1986. U.K. 93 min. Not Rated. Directed by Derek Jarman.

About the film:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caravaggio_%28movie%29http://movies.yahoo.com/movie/caravaggio/

 For those who do not know the Aetna Theater it is in the Wadsworth Atheneum and can be entered on the side entrance of the Wadsworth, near the Travelers building.

On-Street Parking
Two-hour kiosk parking is available, $1 per hour. The kiosks accept coins, debit cards, and credit cards. Display the printed parking receipt on the dashboard inside your vehicle. Parking is free after 6 pm on weekdays and all day on weekends. Please observe posted signs. Some areas are tow zones after 3:30 pm weekdays.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in the concession area to the theater at 6:40, I will where the Black and white scarf with piano keys
item.name: Caravaggio (Free Screening)
